HeroSection.title: Internxt: A Secure {{competitor}} Alternative
HeroSection.pCloudDescription: Looking for a secure alternative to pCloud? Internxt offers the first cloud storage with post quantum encryption and a full privacy suite of products for maximum privacy and security.
HeroSection.dropboxDescription: A past Dropbox data breach leaked 68 million passwords. Want to stop this from happening to you? Join Internxt for complete security and privacy, providing maximum protection against data breaches.
HeroSection.megaDescription: Past vulnerabilities in MEGA’s cryptography and lack of full open source software could put your privacy and data at risk. Choose Internxt for post-quantum encryption, VPN, Mail, Meet, and more.

VersusSection.title: Internxt vs {{competitor}}
VersusSection.description: See why Internxt’s commitment to open-source transparency and independent audits makes it a more trustworthy and secure {{competitor}} alternative

features.title: Open-Source Code
features.description: As Internxt's code is open to everybody on GitHub, anyone may examine it and ensure its security. This transparency guarantees there are no hidden backdoors.

features.title: End-to-End Encryption
features.description: Your data is encrypted client-side, which guarantees that only you can access it.

features.title: Fully audited
features.description: Internxt's services have been reviewed by security experts from a leading European penetration testing company. This ensures your data stays secure against external threats like hackers and breaches.

features.title: Proprietary software
features.description: The closed-source aspect of pCloud's code means only the company has access to it. You have no way to check what is happening with their data.

features.title: pCloud Crypto
features.description: This encryption feature is not open-source and is an extra-paid feature (free users are not protected). This brings to question its real security and transparency.

features.title: Password Storage Concerns
features.description: Without open-source verification, how can you be sure that pCloud does not save your password or that other people can't access it?

inxtTable.title: Security and privacy at no extra cost

features.title: Reasonable plans
features.description: 87% exclusive offer, without any hidden charges.

features.title: Full protection
features.description: All plans include post-quantum and zero-knowledge encryption and security features for free.

features.title: Pay extra for zero-knowledge encryption
features.description: You have to pay for the pCloud Crypto add-on to get private encryption.

features.title: Hidden costs
features.description: Although pCloud plans may seem affordable, the additional cost for an essential client-side encryption or additional download traffic can make it expensive.

features.title: Community-Driven Development
features.description: Because Internxt is open source, it can be improved through community contributions and frequent evaluations by security professionals.

features.title: No Secrets
features.description: Clear policies and open-source code ensure that there are no surprises.

features.title: Proprietary Software
features.description: pCloud is not transparent because it uses closed-source software

features.title: Trust Issues
features.description: Users have to trust pCloud blindly with their data without being able to check it.

features.title: Easy interface
features.description: Simple to use with a focus on security and privacy.

features.title: Cross-platform
features.description: Works on all major platforms, including WebDAV, and Rclone.

features.title: Multiple plans
features.description: Internxt offers family, business, and S3 object storage plans with API access for businesses and developers.

pCloudTable.title: Additional features but at a price

features.title: Feature set
features.description: pCloud offers many features but they come at an extra cost and privacy issues.

features.title: Accessibility
features.description: Paying extra for essential feature like encryption hurt the overall experience.

features.description: Has multiple plans, but no S3 object storage restricts scalability and cloud-native use for businesses and developers.

switchToInternxt.title: Switch to Internxt for a more secure, open, cost-effective cloud storage solution

isPCloudSafeSection.title: Is pCloud safe?
isPCloudSafeSection.description: pCloud's closed-source encryption makes it difficult to verify its security effectiveness, raising concerns about accessing your files.

cards.title: Suspicious emails
cards.description: Many pCloud users have received phishing emails from scammers. It's unclear how hackers got these emails, but pCloud denies a data breach.

cards.title: Encryption
cards.description: Zero-knowledge encryption is an additional cost with pCloud. Consequently, free or even paid users might find their information less protected.

cards.title: Content scanning
cards.description: Many pCloud users have reported their accounts being unfairly terminated and taken down without warning due to suspected trademark violations or illegal content.

cards.title: Trackers
cards.description: pCloud uses trackers on its website (from Facebook, Twitter, and TikTok) to collect your data, increasing the risk of privacy breaches and unwanted marketing

HorizontalpCloudScrollableSection.title: Is pCloud safe?
HorizontalpCloudScrollableSection.description: pCloud's closed-source encryption makes it difficult to verify its security effectiveness, raising concerns about accessing your files.

descriptions: A lot of pCloud users have received phishing emails from scammers. It's unclear how hackers got these emails, but pCloud denies a data breach.
Zero-knowledge encryption costs extra with pCloud Crypto. All users without it have significantly weaker protection. Without this additional encryption, pCloud can scan and access users' files.
Many pCloud users have reported their accounts being unfairly terminated and taken down without warning due to suspected trademark violations or illegal content.
pCloud uses trackers on its website (Facebook, Twitter, TikTok) to collect your data increasing the risk of privacy breaches and unwanted marketing

HorizontalDropboxScrollableSection.title: Is Dropbox safe?
HorizontalDropboxScrollableSection.description: Since 2011, Dropbox has faced numerous security breaches. Don’t risk your data; secure it with Internxt Drive and protect your online privacy.

descriptions: In June 2011, Dropbox experienced a major security breach due to a bug that allowed any password to access any account for four hours, provided a hacker had access to the email or username. During those four hours, all Dropbox accounts were vulnerable.

In 2012, Dropbox usernames and passwords were stolen from other sites, leading to a major breach. Dropbox didn't disclose the full extent until 2016, revealing that 68 million users were compromised, making it one of the largest cloud storage and internet breaches in history.

In 2018, a Harvard study used anonymized data from Dropbox without users' consent to collaborate with research teams. Although the data was anonymized, sharing user data with third parties without permission is a huge breach of trust, transparency, and your online privacy.

In November 2022, a phishing attack stole a Dropbox employee’s credentials by impersonating GitHub. The attack also stole and leaked emails and passwords from numerous employees online. GitHub, not Dropbox, detected the attack.

HorizontalMegaScrollableSection.title: Is Dropbox safe?
HorizontalMegaScrollableSection.description: Since 2011, Dropbox has faced numerous security breaches. Don’t risk your data; secure it with Internxt Drive and protect your online privacy.
HorizontalMegaScrollableSection.description2: Researchers from ETH Zurich discovered major cryptographic flaws in MEGA, affecting 250M+ users and over 1,000 Petabytes of data. Four key vulnerabilities were identified:

descriptions: MEGA’s login process leaks hints about your private RSA key if attackers (with server access) modify your encrypted key. Initially requiring 512 logins, researchers later reduced this to just six. Once obtained, the key allows attackers to access files, chats, and more.
With your RSA key, attackers can exploit MEGA’s AES-ECB encryption to access node, chat, and signing keys—granting full access to files and messages.
An attacker can plant fake, incriminating files in your account that appear as legitimate uploads, potentially framing you.
A “Guess-and-Purge” technique targets MEGA’s flawed RSA padding checks during encrypted chat key exchanges. After ~100,000 login attempts, attackers can decrypt secret messages.

HorizontalpCloudScrollableSection.title: Why should you choose Internxt as your pCloud alternative?
HorizontalpCloudScrollableSection.description: Discover features of Internxt that make us a more secure, private pCloud alternative

descriptions: Internxt is an open-source alternative to pCloud, as the code for all our products and services is available on GitHub. Our commitment to data security guarantees transparency about how your data is handled and protected.
Internxt's services have been reviewed by security experts by a leading European penetration testing company. This ensures your data stays secure against external threats like hackers and breaches.

If you don’t want your data monitored to show personalized ads, then Internxt is a more private alternative to pCloud. We don’t use any trackers on our website that can review, monitor, or profit from your browsing.

Internxt operates with complete transparency, ensuring your data privacy is protected by European laws. Our GDPR compliance guarantees your information is handled securely and according to strict regulations.

Internxt includes post-quantum encryption, the most secure and advanced cryptography available for free and paid accounts. We only store the encrypted version of your data, and only you have the key to decrypt and access it.

Internxt Drive offers more paid plans and greater storage options than the pCloud pricing structure. If you need a pCloud alternative that offers annual and lifetime plans, choose from any of our affordable plans with VPN, Antivirus, Mail, Meet, and more.

HorizontalDropboxScrollableSection.title: Why should you choose Internxt as your Dropbox alternative?
HorizontalDropboxScrollableSection.description: Internxt takes every measure to secure your files and right to privacy, making it the most secure alternative to Dropbox.

descriptions: Unlike Dropbox’s proprietary software, Internxt is an open-source cloud service. All our product codes are available for review on GitHub for full transparency on how we protect and handle your data.
Internxt's services have been reviewed by security experts at a leading European penetration testing company. This ensures your data stays secure against external threats like hackers and breaches.

Internxt protects your passwords and files with ultra-powerful end-to-end encryption. Unlike Dropbox, Internxt can never access your files for any reason. Only you have the encryption keys to access your data.

Internxt operates with complete transparency, ensuring your data privacy is protected by European laws. Our GDPR compliance guarantees your information is handled securely and according to strict regulations.

Internxt includes post-quantum and zero-knowledge encryption for your free and paid accounts. Unlike Dropbox, your files are encrypted on your device, not on our servers, making Internxt a more private Dropbox alternative.

Internxt Drive offers more paid plans and greater storage options than Dropbox. If you need a Dropbox alternative that offers annual and lifetime plans, choose the right plan for you to get access to VPN, Antivirus, Mail, Meet, and more.

HorizontalMegaScrollableSection.title: Why should you choose Internxt as your MEGA alternative?
HorizontalMegaScrollableSection.description: Discover features of Internxt that make us a more secure, private MEGA alternative

descriptions: Internxt is an open-source alternative to MEGA, as the code for all our products and services is available on GitHub. MEGA does not publish the backend source code that stores your data and enforces encryption policies, so there’s no way of being sure how your data is protected.

Internxt successfully passed a security audit carried out by security experts from a leading European penetration testing company. Past security audits on MEGA found vulnerabilities that could give hackers access to user data, but MEGA has since fixed these issues.

Internxt makes all its source code available on GitHub. This transparency offers you peace of mind that our encryption protects your files, and there are no backdoors that could decrypt and access your data.
Internxt is a European-based company regulated by the GDPR to guarantee your information is handled securely and according to strict regulations.

Internxt includes post-quantum encryption, the most secure and advanced cryptography available for free and paid accounts. We only store the encrypted version of your data, and only you have the key to decrypt and access it.

Internxt includes post-quantum encryption, the most secure and advanced cryptography available for free and paid accounts. This protects your data from the future threats of quantum computers, which could break current encryption methods. MEGA has yet to implement PQE.

faq.question: Is Internxt a more secure and private alternative to pCloud?
answer: Yes, Internxt offers more advanced features to protect your data without charging you extra for them. Post-quantum and zero-knowledge encryption guarantees nobody but you can view your files.

Additional features such as VPN, Antivirus, Device Cleaner, Dark Web Monitor, Meet, and Mail, features not currently available with pCloud, also offer you additional protection from hackers and data breaches.

faq.question: What is post-quantum encryption, and is it more secure?
answer: Unlike standard encryption, post-quantum encryption algorithms are built to resist powerful quantum attacks, making PQE a more secure pCloud alternative.
This cryptography method is used by Internxt to ensure that your lifetime cloud storage plan protects you against future cybersecurity threats and is available for all plans at no extra cost.

faq.question: Where is Internxt based?
answer: Internxt is based in Valencia, Spain, making it a GDPR compliant cloud storage solution that follows strict laws to ensure your data and privacy are protected.

faq.question: Is pCloud pricing more expensive than Internxt?
answer: With your exclusive 87% discount, all our plans are cheaper than pCloud pricing options currently available, with the benefit of offering many more features and privacy than pCloud.

faq.question: How do I contact support?
answer: If you have any more questions, requests, or need assistance, you can contact hello@internxt.com and our Customer Success Team will be happy to help.

faq.question: Can I add more storage to my lifetime plan?
answer: Yes, you can upgrade your plan from the settings of your Internxt account if you need to add more storage.

faq.question: Can I pay with credit card, PayPal, or cryptocurrency?
answer: Internxt currently accepts debit and credit cards (Mastercard, VISA, American Express, etc). You can also pay via PayPal, iDEAL, Sofort, and Cryptocurrency.

faq.question: Is Internxt a more secure and private alternative to Dropbox?
answer: Yes, Internxt is designed to be a more secure and private alternative to Dropbox. Thanks to zero-knowledge and post-quantum encryption, only you can access and decrypt your files.
Unlike Dropbox, Internxt does not scan, track, or sell your data, ensuring full privacy for all your information.

faq.question: Does Dropbox use zero-knowledge encryption?
answer: No, Dropbox does not offer zero-knowledge encryption. This means Dropbox employees or third parties could potentially access your stored files.
Internxt guarantees that nobody, not even our team, can see your data.

faq.question: Where is Internxt based?
answer: Internxt is based in Valencia, Spain, and complies with strict European GDPR privacy regulations.
This ensures higher privacy standards compared to providers like Dropbox, which are based in the United States and may be subject to surveillance laws.

faq.question: Is Internxt pricing cheaper than Dropbox?
answer: Yes, with our exclusive discounts, Internxt plans are more affordable than Dropbox’s, while including additional privacy-focused features at no extra cost.

faq.question: What extra features does Internxt offer that Dropbox doesn’t?
answer: Internxt includes features like a built-in VPN, antivirus, device cleaner, dark web monitor, and private email (Mail).
These tools add extra layers of security and privacy not available with Dropbox.

faq.question: How can I contact Internxt support?
answer: If you need help, you can reach our Customer Success team by emailing hello@internxt.com or using the live chat on our website.

faq.question: Can I pay with credit card, PayPal, or cryptocurrency?
answer: Yes, Internxt accepts debit and credit cards (Mastercard, VISA, American Express, etc.), PayPal, iDEAL, Sofort, and cryptocurrency.

faq.question: Is Internxt a more secure and private alternative to MEGA?
answer: Yes, Internxt is a more secure and private alternative to MEGA. Our zero-knowledge and post-quantum encryption ensure that only you can access your data.
Unlike MEGA, Internxt does not rely on third-party services or trackers, offering a truly private environment for your files.

faq.question: Does MEGA offer the same level of encryption as Internxt?
answer: MEGA uses encryption, but Internxt takes security further by implementing post-quantum encryption, which protects your data even against future quantum computing threats.
This technology is included in every Internxt plan at no extra cost.

faq.question: Where is Internxt based?

This provides stronger privacy protection compared to services like MEGA, which may be subject to different jurisdictions and regulations.
